org.cfpm.factbaseExtension
Class FactBaseRetractAll

java.lang.Object
  org.nlogo.api.DefaultCommand
      org.cfpm.factbaseExtension.FactBaseRetractAll
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.nlogo.api.Command, org.nlogo.api.Primitive, scala.ScalaObject
public class FactBaseRetractAll
extends org.nlogo.api.DefaultCommand

This class implements the "retract-all" primitive for the factbase extension. Retract-all finds all facts satisfying the given condition and then retracts them from the fact base. If there are no such facts, nothing happens. To call this primitive from NetLogo, use factbase:retract-all fact-base condition-task condition-field-list

Author:
Ruth Meyer

getSyntax

public org.nlogo.api.Syntax getSyntax()
The retract-all primitive expects a fact base and a condition (specified as a reporter task and a list of corresponding fields) as inputs.

Specified by:

perform

public void perform(org.nlogo.api.Argument[] args,
                    org.nlogo.api.Context context)
             throws org.nlogo.api.ExtensionException,
                    org.nlogo.api.LogoException
Retracts all facts satisfying the given condition from the specified fact base. The first argument args[0] has to be a fact base, the second argument args[1] has to be a reporter task and the third argument has to be a list of field names corresponding to the formal arguments used in the task.

Parameters:
args - the arguments to this call of retract-all
context - the NetLogo context
Throws:
org.nlogo.api.ExtensionException
org.nlogo.api.LogoException
See Also:
Command.perform(org.nlogo.api.Argument[], org.nlogo.api.Context)
